Model: 3D Ex vivo Human Adipose Tissue Model
Organs/Tissues: Human subcutaneous fat (mini-explants with native adipocytes, stroma, vasculature)
Physiological/Pathological: Both – healthy or induced inflammation/fibrosis/obesity-like states
Cell Source: Primary donor adipose tissue (retains all cell types in original fat)
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (adipocytes, progenitors, endothelial, fibroblasts, resident immune)
Stromal Cells: Yes (native fibroblasts, mesenchymal cells in the tissue)
Tissue-resident Immune: Yes, whatever immune cells are present in donor fat (e.g. macrophages)
Circulating Immune: No (no perfusion system), though external immune cell addition is possible in static culture
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No integrated multi-organ approach; single tissue system
Air-Liquid Interface: No, submerged in medium with gentle shaking
Extracellular Matrix: Yes, native ECM of the adipose is preserved
3D Scaffold: Yes, the original tissue architecture forms the scaffold
Notable Features: Viable up to 8 weeks, maintain vascular networks, allows modeling of obesity/fibrosis, real human fat physiology
Plate/Format (Throughput): Static wells/flasks with gentle agitation, low–medium throughput
Readouts - Live Imaging: Possible with confocal on small tissue pieces, but more commonly endpoint
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Yes (enzymatic digestion for flow cytometry, RNA analysis)
Dead Volume: Minimal, each well volume + tissue chunk
Perfused: No. Culture with mild mechanical agitation only
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Manual changes (media, stimuli), no dynamic flow
model_availability: Product & Service (ExAdEx provides tissue model or runs assays)
